title: Dramatic moment cow is rescued by dog-walkers who chop tree down
text:
A cow caught her head inside a tree and had to be sawed free by dog-walkers in Denmark.

Julius Engedal was walking through a field in Bording, Denmark, with his sister and mother when they noticed the cow had jammed her head.

The Jersey Cow had been abandoned by the rest of her herd and the family took it upon themselves to save it on August 20.

Julius Engedal stumbled across a Jersey Cow who had its head stuck in a tree (pictured) while walking with his mother and sister in Bording, Denmark, on August 20

In the tense clip, one of the family member's can be heard cutting through the tree while the cow is provided the perfect distraction of their black Labrador.

The beloved pet lies down on the grass next to the cow, whose head is poking through the branches, and they sniff each other.

It then jumps at the cow and hopes to play, while the family can be heard chopping away at the tree.

A member of the Engedal family documents the incident and shows a determined look to free the farm animal with their chopping tool in hand

While the family hacked away at the tree, their beloved black Labrador distracted the cow and wanted to play

The animal can be seen craning its necking and holding still as it patiently waits to be cut free.

And after 10 minutes of sawing, the family manage to chop the tree and one of the family member's pushes down on the tree to let it give way.

After a concerted effort to push and yank the tree, it breaks into two.

Moment of victory: One of Julius's family tugs at the tree (pictured left) after chopping through and it eventually gives way (pictured right)

Moments later, the family can be heard exclaiming 'yay' as the Jersey cow makes a speedy exit.

They hoist up the branch and seem very pleased as the cow happily trots away.

The cow scans the grass for food after letting out a call to the other cows who appear to have abandoned it.

And the family say 'aww' as they watch the farm animal disappear into the distance.
description: Julius Engedal noticed the Jersey Cow's head trapped in a tree while walking with his mother and sister through a field in Bording, Denmark, on August 20. Was saved after 10 minutes.
